raw:
{{Infobox item poe2
| name           = Aim'Spirente
| icon           = poe2 note_crumpled icon.png
| description    = Someone has scrawled the lyrics to a traditional sailor shanty on this ragged scrap of paper.

"It is a fine three-master thin like a bird. Heave-ho, Aim'Spirente! Of Captain Parfitto, 's never said a hard word, As we sail our troubles away.

Hold fast the helm, hold fast the wind. Heave-ho, Aim'Spirente! Ondra's grace, or we'll all be skinned As we sail down Deadfire way

We've gone away long, left our loves behind. Heave-ho, Aim'Spirente! It caused me a sorrow most unkind. While crossing down Deadfire way

They say in Deadfire the luminous grows Heave-ho, Aim'Spirente! And so that's where our brave ship goes, To make our fortunes one day.

The next day on sail we back with cheers, Heave-ho, Aim'Spirente! On Spirento fair, we'll see our dears And shower them with two months' pay!

Hold fast the course, hold fast the waves Heave-ho, Aim'Spirente! If we don't wind up in salty graves We'll come back to Spirento someday!

It is a fine three-master thin like a bird. Heave-ho, Aim'Spirente! Of Captain Parfitto, 's never said a hard word, As we sail our troubles away."
